intro: Centaurea rhizantha, commonly known as the purplehead centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and produces striking violet-blue to purple flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in dry, rocky soils. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. Centaurea rhizantha is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soils.
